intro: Brassica sativa subsp. rapa, commonly known as Chinese kale or gai lan, is a leafy vegetable characterized by its dark green, thick, and stalked leaves. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other cruciferous vegetables like broccoli and cabbage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, yellow flowers that develop into siliques containing seeds. Its leaves are rich in nutrients such as vitamins A, C, and K, as well as dietary fiber and antioxidants. This subspecies is well adapted to temperate climates and is cultivated for its edible leaves in many parts of Asia.
